intro: Draba santaquinensis, commonly known as the Santaquin sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species typically grows in rocky soils and dry habitats, showcasing its adaptation to harsh environments. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Draba santaquinensis is often found in desert scrub and sagebrush communities, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
